DataElement.preferredName: Patient Prior Chemotherapy Hypersensitivity Personal Medical History Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/not applicable indicator related to information related to an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced regarding a local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized to an earlier use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Prior Chemotherapy Hypersensitivity Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced regarding a local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized to an earlier use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Prior Chemotherapy Hypersensitivity Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term may be used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is most commonly used to refer to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer.  Cancer chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells.  Because cancer cells usually divide much faster than normal cells, they are often very sensitive to the inhibitory actions of chemotherapeutic agents.  Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity. (NCI04):A local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have a histo
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of hypersensitivity reactions to prior chemotherapy administered for previous cancer diagnoses that consisted of anaphylaxis not amenable to desensitization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: GOG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: If yes, was the patient successfully retreated following a desensitization program or protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known hypersensitivity to letrozole or hypersensitivity/intolerance to carboplatin/paclitaxel therapy?
